text: Thank you, that was very helpful!

elements.text: Thank you, that was very helpful!

text: if you have a streaming json decoder then its not such a big deal. however if, like most people, you download the whole json message then decode it in one go and then handle each market in sequence, you will do much better if the snapshot is segmented because you can start doing your market handling faster, while the rest of the json downloads and decodes on another thread and feeds that process. on betfair's side, they prefer segmented messages because it reduces memory load when assembling very large messages and allows them to send you data faster as the first message will be ready more quickly. generally, most of the time, because this is all startup stuff its not very relevant. on our systems we certainly never bother with it. we talk to betfair via 1/10 Gbit links and initial decoding only happens once before any trading etc kicks in. imo it's all Joe's fault.
